page.title: 15BROUGHTY FERRY - LANDSCAPE
page.content: Most of this area, not very long ago, used to be countryside overlooking the wide estuary of the River Tay.With the speed of housing development much of this land is now covered by housing. Green belts and parks help to retain its character with of course the beach area providing a natural base. {FISHERHOUSES}Mention must be made of the Fisherhouses which are a feature of the harbour and beach area. Outwardly little has changed but the majority have been renovated and restored internally. {HARBOUR }In the past the Harbour was used for the fishing fleet and ferry crossing of the River Tay. Now it is used solely for pleasure craft. A Lifeboat is stationed at Broughty Ferry.
